page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: Probably the greatest change in land use for at least one hundred years is now taking place in this area. A new road, an extension of the A39 Taunton to Fraddon is now cutting a swathe through farms and woods. A continuation of the Barnstaple By-pass the new Torridge Bridge and Bideford By-pass, it is due to be opened in Spring 1987. Realignment of existing roads and a massive fly over in the Kenwith Valley are involved. It is doubtful whether as much human activity has taken place in that valley since the Saxon King Hubba fought the Danes there in the 9th century. A low power independent television relay station exists to serve low lying areas of Westward Ho!
